title: Songs from the Well: A Memoir of Love and Grief
description: Songs from the Well is a memoir, selected from the author's writings and told in essays and poetry, of the author's life with his wife, Lee, through her diagnosis with brain cancer and death five months later, to the aftermath of dealing with his grief and facing a life without her.Adam Byrn Tritt, MEd, CH, LMT, is an internationally bestselling author, a poet, essayist, screenwriter, teacher, social activist, and humorist. In addition to Songs from the Well, Tritt is the author of The Phoenix and the Dragon: Poems of the Alchemical Transformation, a collection of his poetry, as well as several works of nonfiction including the bestselling Tellstones: Runic Divination in the Welsh Tradition.
